facts: The first computer virus was created in 1986. Named 'Brain' it was developed by two Pakistani brothers to prevent software piracy but ended up spreading globally.

The term 'bug' in computing originated from an actual insect. In 1947, a moth was found trapped inside a Harvard Mark II computer, causing a malfunction. This led to the popularization of the term 'debugging'.
The first computer mouse was made of wood. Invented by Douglas Engelbart in 1964, it had a simple design with a single button.
More than 90% of the world's currency exists digitally. Most transactions happen electronically, with only a small percentage in physical cash.
Artificial Intelligence wrote its first book in 2016. A Japanese AI program co-authored a novel that passed the first round of a literary competition.
